courses.name: Graphics
courses.description: Graphics is an upper level elective for those pursuing the graphics vector.

courses.name: Object Oriented Programming
courses.description: OOP is required major level class. Learn how to implement some basic data structures and algorithms.

courses.name: Python
courses.description:
Python is the introductory CS class.
Learn about the basics of CS and make the game brick breaker

courses.name: Databases
courses.description: Learn how to store data and expand on your knowledge of data structures

courses.name: Artifical Intelligence
courses.description: Often in demand, AI is difficult to get into! Learn about the fundamentals of AI

courses.name: Game Design
courses.description: Become the next great game maker. This course is intense. But it is so worth it.

courses.name: Networks
courses.description: Even though most people use it as a liberal study, network science is powerful!

courses.name: Data Driven Web Applications
courses.description: Get a taste of D3 and some JS to add to your backend knowledge!

courses.name: Compilers
courses.description: This class makes you legit. This class is your life.

courses.name: Operating Systems
courses.description: This is one of the most important courses. You can finally understand synchronization.

advisors.name: Michael Clarkson
advisors.description: He's known for teaching 3110 and is interested in security.

advisors.name: Walker White
advisors.description: He's known for teaching 1110 and is interested in game design.

advisors.name: Anne Bracy
advisors.description: She's known for teaching 3410 and has worked at Intel.

advisors.name: Daisy Fan
advisors.description: She's known for teaching 1112 and applies CS to environmental engineering.

advisors.name: Kavita Bala
advisors.description: She's known for teaching 4620 and is passionate about graphics.

advisors.name: Andrew Myers
advisors.description: He's known for teaching 2112 and he runs the CMS team.

advisors.name: David Gries
advisors.description: He's known for teaching 2110 and he was present at the first SWE conference.

advisors.name: Michael George
advisors.description: He's known for teaching 2800 and he completed his PhD at Cornell.

advisors.name: Jon Kleinberg
advisors.description: He's known for teaching 2850 and also upper level network science classes.

summer_plans.name: Internship at Facebook
summer_plans.description: You are an intern on the Facebook messenger team

summer_plans.name: Internship at Jane Street Capital
summer_plans.description: You are an intern at Jane Street Capital and you are using OCaml to develop trading algorithms

summer_plans.name: Research at Cornell
summer_plans.description: You are spending the summer at Cornell researching under your favorite professor.

summer_plans.name: Research at UMass Amherst
summer_plans.description: You are spending the summer at UMass researching under a famous professor.

summer_plans.name: Internship at a startup
summer_plans.description: You are working at a new startup in SF that just got angel investors

summer_plans.name: Internship at Microsoft
summer_plans.description: You are working at Microsoft on the Cortana team. You're hoping to meet Bill Gates

summer_plans.name: Taking classes at Cornell
summer_plans.description: You are trying to catch up on your degree and thus must take classes over the summer

summer_plans.name: Personal Project
summer_plans.description: You are embarking on a personal project. Great things are expected

summer_plans.name: Traveling
summer_plans.description: You are traveling this summer. You're visiting Prague, Hong Kong, Seoul, New Delhi among other places

summer_plans.name: Teaching a coding class
summer_plans.description: You are teaching middle and high school kids introductory computer science!

future_plans.name: Industry-Big Corp
future_plans.description: You are working at a large corporation like Google, Facebook or Amazon.

future_plans.name: MEng at Cornell
future_plans.description: You returned to Cornell for an MEng. Then you plan to pursue industry.

future_plans.name: Industry-Start Up
future_plans.description: You are working at a startup that is about to IPO

future_plans.name: Masters at Cornell
future_plans.description: You are pursuing your masters at Cornell for two years

future_plans.name: PhD at University of California, Berkeley
future_plans.description: You are pursuing a PhD in artifical intelligence at Berkeley!

future_plans.name: Investment Banking
future_plans.description: You took your business minor and CS major and went into I-banking

action.description: Get ready for the Life of a CS Major! Where will you go?

You have made the odyssey to the land of Ithaca, eager and ready. 
Choose between Arts and Sciences or Engineering.

It's your first day on campus and you got lost. 
Lose 20 points.

You applied for a project team and now you're waiting on results. 
Get some karma.

You got a 100 on your first CS assignment. Congratulations! 
You get 500 points.

You went to a GBody for WICC or ACSU. 
You got a really awesome mentor to help you out! 
Get 300 points and some karma.

Career fair is coming up, should you go? 
Type y to go to career fair (spend 15 points). 
Type n to stay in lecture (spend 5 points).

optlist.description: You went to career fair and got 267 karma worth of swag! (And maybe a job?)

You decided to go to class and don't need to catch up on the material later. 
Only 24 karma though because you didn't expand your network.

action.description:
You need a partner for your next CS assignment. 
But you couldn't find one. 
Lose 900 points.

You went to a tech talk for Google and got free dinner. 
Get 300 points and karma

As a freshman, you got onto a project team for the CS team with no experience! 
Get 1000 points and karma!

You aced your first CS prelim! Two standard deviations above the mean! 
Get 1500 points and karma!

You failed your first CS prelim! Two standard deviations below the mean! 
Lose 800 points.

You slept through lecture today and the Prof took attendance. 
Lose 500 points and get some karma for getting sleep.

It's add drop. Select a course for this semester! 
Get 400 points for getting one of your top choices.

Your laptop ran out of battery while you were on central. 
Lose 200 points.

You pulled your first all-nighter. Congrats? 
Get 500 points and karma.

You went to office hours and got to talk to your professor. 
Get 200 points and karma.

You decided to go to an ACSU GBody meeting. 
Get 0 points for eating free pizza.

You're at office hours and it's super crowded. 
Type s to stay (spend 100 points) and l to leave (spend 10 points).

optlist.description:
You stayed and made a ton of progress on your pset!! 
365 karma for being patient~

You decided to go to class and don't need to catch up on the material later.
Lose 24 karma for losing a networking opportunity

action.description:
You went to office hours and made a friend.
Get 200 points for friendships through struggle.

YOU WROTE 100 LINES OF ~BEAUTIFUL~ CODE. AMAZING. 
100 points for elegance.

You lost all your code. Too bad you didn't know about git.
Lose 1000 points.

You completed the assignment early! You got sleep! WOW.
Get 300 points.

You forgot to accept your partner's invite on CMS. 
 Now you pray to the CS gods.
Lose 1023 points.

You want to buy a new laptop. 
Type m to purchase a Mac for 1000 points or p to purchase a PC for 400 points.

optlist.description:
You got a Mac! Unfortunately, you only have one port, but at least it's Unix-based. 
4011 karma for a nice Granny Smith.

You got a PC! Unfortunately, this requires you to download every VM in the world. 
1044 karma for not hopping on the Mac bandwagon.

action.description:
You got a TA room to yourself in Gates!
2342 points for a productive day!

You got kicked out of a TA room in Gates.
Lose 2209 points.

Your question on Piazza was never answered. 
You look at the red dot and feel 78 points slipping away.

You've been trying to debug something for 10 hours only 
to realize you're working on the wrong file.
Lose 366 points.

You finally get what an object is! Now you no longer object to being a CS major.
Get 750 points.

You hear about these one credit courses called AEWs. 
Type a to take an AEW at 7:30pm (spend 73 points) or n to not take the AEW (spend 0 points).

optlist.description:
You decided to take the AEW!! Though the night section isn't fun, you learn a lot.
Gain 730 karma!

You decided to not take the AEW. Missing lecture isn't really an option now.
Lose 199 karma.

action.description:
You got the mean on a CS assignment.
0 points for being mediocre.

It's pre-enroll. Select a course for next semester! 
Get 350 points for waking up on time.

You slept through a prelim. Uh oh. 
You will have to lose 298 points.

You spill water all over your laptop. There are no napkins around.
Lose 1009 points for carelessness.

You're struggling in your physics class. You're not sure why you're taking it (just kidding, it fulfills a requirement).
Type t to find a tutor (spend 68 points) and o to figure it out on your own (spend 88 points).

optlist.description:
You decided to find a tutor. She's extremely helpful, and you're happy you made this decision.
Get 111 karma for taking the initiative.

You decided to go to class and don't need to catch up on the material later.
You lose 444 karma because it's such a struggle.

action.description:
CMS crashed. 
Lose 307 points for being unlucky.

You tried Java Swing. You missed. GUI BYE.
Lose 643 points.

It's time to decide what you want to do this summer. 
461 points for being proactive.

This day sucks. But you get free Dino BBQ from Capital One. 
Get 10 points for perservering.

You discovered Stack Overflow. Your life has been changed.
Get 400 points.

You joined the CS majors group on Facebook. So much love <3 So many memes 
900 points for a close community.

You submitted the wrong file on CMS. Uh-oh. Too bad you only found after it got graded.
Lose 1982 points.

Bill Gates is coming! Do you skip 2800 to wait in line for tickets? 
Type y to skip (spend 200 points) and n to stay (spend 5 points).

optlist.description:
Mike George is sad that you skipped lecture :( But you got to see Bill Gates!
Get 176 karma.

You didn't spend money or see Bill Gates or wait in line or miss class. 
Get 0 karma for making a nice, netural decision.

action.description:
It's 3Day Startup and you listen to the pitches. Some people are so smart! 
255 points for being inspired.

You're in a writing class. Unfortunately you don't know how to write anything but Java. 
Buy yourself some java to get through the night.
Lose 400 points.

You don't have to take the 2110 final! CONGRATS!
Get 2110 points.

Regrades are due tonight, but the handback room was closed when you went there to check. 
You lose 39 points.

Today is a great day. It's sunny, you're sunny, the whole world is sunny.
800 points for a beautiful day.

You're exhausted. You're sitting in Gates and Gimme Coffee is right there. 
Type c to buy coffee (spend 10 points) and s to skip this opportunity (spend 0 points).

optlist.description:
You decided to caffeinate yourself. Woot. 
Lose 37 karma for a minor bad life decision.

You decide to skip the coffee. Good life decision.
Gain 99 karma for a healthy life decision.

action.description:
You got google cardboard. Virtual reality > actual reality.
Get 279 points.

Life segfaulted. 
Lose 480 points.

You need to choose an advisor. 
You also get karma points.

You finished your assignment but forget to write specs. Specs are important.
Lose 890 points for poor documentation.

Your CS partner decided to drop the class. 
Tough luck bud, you have to find a new one. 
Lose 33 points.

There are bugs in your code. There are bugs in your room. 
Lose 912 points.

Go to your faculty advisor's office hours to ask a question. Their students are still asking questions.
Type w to wait for them to finish (spend 50 points) or l to leave now (spend 2 points).

optlist.description:
You wait for your faculty advisor to finish. 
Your patience is rewarded with 98 karma.

You decide to leave and come back later. 
Get 2 karma for saving some time.

action.description:
You have discovered your favorite data structure-linkedlists! 
Get 100 points for linking!

You have discovered your least favorite data structure-trees. 
You're environmental science friends don't understand why you hate trees.
Lose 100 points.

You went home for fall break! It was so nice to be with your fam. 
Get 193 points.

You got sick from staying up late. Take care of yourself. 
Lose 1923 points.

It's the last lecture of your favorite CS class. Your mind was blown. 
Get 3000 points.

You need to find a partner in your CS class. 
Type f to ask a friend to help you (spend 15 points) or r to go random (spend 5 points).

optlist.description:
Your friend pairs you with one of their close friends who ends up being super easy to work with. 
40 points for you.

You go random. Your partner's a little strange, but at least they're nice. 
Get 15 points for meeting a new person.

action.description:
You got your classic chipotle chicken from Duffield. Life tastes good. 
Get 679 points.

It's only week six of the semester and you ran out of BRBs. 
Lose 500 points.

YOUR CODE WORKS. YOUR GROUP MEMBERS ARE JUMPING UP AND DOWN FOR JOY!!! 
You got 475 points.

The consultant at office hours didn't answer your question. 
Lose 135 points.

What are you planning for Friday lunch? 
Type c to attend the CS faculty luncheon (spend 8 points) and f to grab lunch with a friend (spend 4 points).

optlist.description:
You go to the faculty luncheon! You get to talk to Michael Clarkson!!!!
311 karma points. This is lunch.

You grab lunch with a friend you haven't seen in a while. 
Get 190 points for catching up with your friend.

action.description:
Your code works on your partner's computer but not yours. You have no idea why. 
Lose 1900 points for the inconvenience.

Your code did not pass make check. You will receive little to no credit. 
Lose 310 points.

Your code passed make check. Yes. Does it work though? 
Get 310 points.

You are no longer scared of the terminal. Congrats. 
Get 10 points.

The CS party is tonight. 
Type g to go (spend 6 points) or s to stay in and code (spend 16 points).

optlist.description:
You go to the CS party :) 
Lose 109 karma for, uh, some unfortunate experiences.

You missed out on socializing, but got a lot of work done.
Get 45 karma for making a good decision.

action.description:
You submitted an empty zip file on CMS. 
Lose 398 points for carelessness :(

You're assignment is due in 4 hours and it's 4AM right now. Will you finish? Probably not. 
Lose 700 points for ruining your health and your grades.

You crashed. Your computer crashed. It's a really unfortunate week. 
You lose 444 points, but at least you got some karma points for making through a rough time.

You applied to be consultant because you want to inspire. 
Get 1000 points for paying it forward.

It's hell week, but you want to go to a hackathon. 
Type g to go to PennApps (spend 108 points) and s to stay in Ithaca (8 points).

optlist.description:
You go to PennApps and win an award. Yayyyyy! 
Get 464 points for having fun and building a sleek app.

You stay in Ithaca to finish your work. Free food and swag would have been nice. 
Lose 60 points for caring too much about grades.

action.description:
There are no assignments due this weekend! 
Go out tonight with some friends and get 99 points.

You're CS partner did all the work and now you feel like shit. 
Lose 100 points.

You got flown out to an interview. 
Get 836 points and a ton of free food that's all paid for.

ACSU is advertising a cool new tshirt design. 
Type p to pay $5 and become a paid member (spend 5 points) or n to pass (spend 0 points).

optlist.description:
You got an ACSU tshirt, and your friends who aren't paid members are a little jealous.
Smirk and get 82 points.

You don't spend the $5, and instead, grab some quality bubble tea from Collegetown.
83 points :)

action.description:
3110 is hard. You have pulled 3 allnighters. 
Lose 3110 points.

You're stuck on 2-3 trees, but your best friend is a 3110 TA! 
Ask them for 3110 points-I mean help on the assignment.

Your code is really crappy. 
Type s to just submit it (spend 3 points) or l to take a late day to improve it (spend 13 points).

optlist.description:
You submit the bad code and are willing to take the penalties. 
20 for bravery - 21 for carelessness = -1 karma

You take a late day and make significant improvements. 
Lose 17 karma for not doing this earlier.

action.description:
A3 was a hot mess. Functors are funky. Why do you need a Set and Dict? 
Lose 400 points for not understanding the assignment.

You don't understand proofs but somehow you pulled an A on A5. 
Get 523 points for getting lucky.

It's time to choose a final project for CS 3110. 
Type l to implement the Game of Life (spend 1000) or m for a boring messenging application (spend 500 points).

optlist.description:
wOW. Life is such a cool game. You made a great decision.
Get 3110 karma ;)

A boring messenging application is still pretty difficult.
Get 1110 karma

action.description: You got a winternship at Yelp. Yay! You can get paid to learn CS.

You tried to get a winternship, but didn't succeed. Now you will sit home and watch Silicon Valley wishing you were there. 
Lose 500 points.

You completed 3110! This has been 3110. 
Get 3110 points.

Rush a professional frat at Cornell. Make friends and build your resume.
Get 103 points.

Cornell CS finally feels like home 
Get 1000 points and some karma.

Your phone died. Your laptop died. There are no chargers. 
Lose 30 points for being unprepared.

It's 2am and your friends are all talking and laughing in Gates.
Type h to hangout (spend 20 points) and g to go home (spend 35 points).

optlist.description:
It was not worth it, but also completely worth it at the same time.
247 points worth of internal conflicts.

You left early and sleep early. 
Zzzzzzzz (222 points).

action.description:
You made your own personal website! It's beautiful 
Get 352 points.

You put the wrong form number on your exam and thus you failed the exam. 
Lose 800 points.

Your faculty advisor went on sabbatical, so you need to choose a new advisor. 
You lost 6 points.

It's time for Grace Hopper! Get free swag and maybe a job.. 
Get 456 points!

You're almost done with a crazy assignment. Push through! 
Get 823 points for perseverance and hard work.

The best days are the days when you can code leisurely. Too bad, that doesn't happen with your time management. 
Lose 235 points.

You want to work a campus job, but don't know if you have the time. 
Type a apply to be a consultant (spend 15 points) or p to pass (spend 1 point).

optlist.description:
You apply to be a consultant and you get the job!
Get 83 karma for seizing this chance.

You decide not to apply.
Lose 38 karma for losing a chance to have this teaching experience..

action.description:
You're at office hours, but the line was so long, the TAs couldn't get to you. 
Lose 165 points, your sanity, your temper, and your faith in humanity.

You are more salty about this class than the ocean. 
Lose 30 points for being sodium annoyed (SO DAMN ANNOYED)

Handshake confuses you. But somehow you still got an interivew? 
Get 899 points.
You didn't do well in an interview. Type t to keep trying (spend 100 points) or Type f to focus on your homework (spend 50 points).

optlist.description: Perseverance is key! Practice makes perfect. Get 1000 karma for not giving up.
School is important, but so is your career. Don't give up so easily. Lose 300 karma.

action.description:
You went to your first hackathon and it was so much fun! You didn't place, but it's the experience that matters.
Get 234 points.

You got 12 hours of sleep. WOW. WOW. 
1248 points.

You created an actual Github for independent projects. 
Get 202 points for at least trying.

You affiliated with the CS major! Congrats fam :') 
9999 points

You realize that CS might not be for you. 
Type s to switch to a minor (spend 1000 points) or Type m to push through and stay a major (spend 1299 points).

optlist.description: It's ok to realize CS might not be for you. Kudos to you for figuring out what's best for you. Get 800 karma.
Sometimes, there are obstacles in life. You know you love CS. You can do it. Get 1000 points for perserverance.

action.description:
Some lucky person in Gates let you borrow their charge. 
Get 100 points.

You go to bed on one day and you get up on a different calendar day. w0w. 
You get 688 points.

The semester's been rough and you have to drop your class :( 
Get 111 points for caring about your own health.

Even though you dropped a class, you're still so stressed because you procrastinate. 
Lose 100 points for poor time management.
You are tired. Zero net gain.

You have lots of work but you also have office hours for CS 1110 and there's an assignment due tonight. 
Type c to cancel office hours to do your own work (spend 100 points) or Type h to hold office hours and support those baby CS majors (spend 50 points).

optlist.description:
You really let down those kids. 
You disappered when they needed you most. 
Lose 400 karma.

You really needed to do work. 
Your academics are important too, plus there are lots of other TAs. 
Lose 550 karma.

action.description:
You spent the whole day sleeping and now you have to pull an allnighter to make it up. 
Lose 600 points for a messed up sleep schedule.

It's time to decide what you want to do this summer. 
461 points for being proactive.

You're so excited for summer that you bragged to your best friend who got rejected from the company you got into and has no offers. 
Lose 1000 for being inconsiderate.

You have two assignments due that both count for 50 % of your grade. 
Type c to do your cs assignment (spend 4110 points) or Type h to write your humanities paper (spend 190 points)

optlist.description:
You have late days you could have used. You should've done your paper. 
Get only 10 karma for poor prioritization.

You really needed help with the writing. Good on you for spending some time working on this. 
Get 500 karma for taking a break from CS.

action.description:
You aced your prelim and your assignment. You are being social. 
Keep smiling cause you got 823 points.

You got an alcove in Duffield! Congrats! Invite your friends. 
Get 284 points.

You're hungry and you have lots of work to do. 
Type p to order pizza at 2am (spend 5 points) or Type n to not order (spend 50 points)

optlist.description:
Pizza is good. But it's not good for you. 
You also ate all of it and crashed instead of finishing your project. 
Lose 500 karma for gaining 500 pounds.

You were so hungry. You need fuel to get through the night so you eat a salad. 
Gain 100 karma for staying healthy.

action.description:
YOUR CODE WORKS. YOUR GROUP MEMBERS ARE JUMPING UP AND DOWN FOR JOY!!! 
You got 475 points.

You haven't showered in 3 days. There's an assignment due.. 
BUT YOU HAVEN'T SHOWERED. IN. THREE.DAYS 
-101 points

Your MIPS processor is due tomorrow, but nothing works. What is ADDIU? What is JAR? 
Lose 500 points for not listening to Bracy.

To shower or not to shower that is the question. 
Type y to shower (spend 400 points) or type n to not (spend 40 points).

optlist.description:
Hygiene is important. You smell good now. 
Get 1000 karma.

You got some extra time, but you stink. Literally. But you have deodorant so it's ok for one day. 
Get 800 karma.

action.description:
C is a piece of shit. It compiles everything. 
Lose 500 points for not understanding pointers.

You forgot how to code in Python. Python is like English. It was your first language. What is your life? 
Lose 10 points.

You need help and you see your favorite TA chilling in Duffield Hall. 
Type a to ask ta for help outside of consulting hours (spend 1000 points) or 
Type s to struggle on your own, but not bother the TA (spend 860 points).

optlist.description:
Luckily, he's super nice and helps you out. 
Get 200 karma.

Good thing you're a good debugger, or at least persistent. 
Get 200 karma.

action.description:
You went the whole day without your laptop dying. THIS IS PROGRESS. 
500 points.

You finally used Vim enough to know how to quit. 
Good job - the gods of CS award you with 621 points.

You still don't get Vim and don't know how to quit. This is sad. Maybe you're an emacs person? 
-1073 points.
You need Linux. Type d to download vm (spend 5 points) or Type i try to install natively (spend 300 points).

optlist.description:
VMs take up so much space and take super longer to download. 
Lose 30 karma.

It's so much nicer to run things natively even though there are so many configuration issues. 
Get 50 karma.

action.description:
You went bowling with Palantir! How cool! Maybe you'll get a job there? 
2129 points.

You finished your business minor! CONGRATS! 
812 points.

You got an award for your hack at Big Red Hacks. 
Yayyyyy, get 510 points!

SLEEP IS FOR THE WEAK. You have been brainwashed. 
-892 points.

YOUR CODE WORKS. OMG IT WORKS. YOU HAVE NO IDEA WHY. BUT IT WORKS. SUBMIT NOW. 
10000 points.
You can either go to lecture (type g and spend 30 points) or skip to finish homework (type s and spend 35 points).

optlist.description:
You find out about extension! Kudos to you for going to class. 
Get 500 karma.

You forgot to turn in the homework. That kinda sucks. No lecture and no value from skipping. 
Lose 300 karma.

action.description:
You have been stress eating and gained 20 points. 
Lose 300 points.
Type f to debug your friend's program (spend 50 points) or Type o to debug your own (spend 1 points).

optlist.description:
You're a good friend. But you didn't finish your project. 
Get 100 karma for true altruism.

Your friend had to drop the class because he couldn't finish and thus failed the assignment. 
You however knew that your bug was just a one line fix. 
Lose 100 karma for not helping him out.

action.description: Life sucks. Lose 300 points for messing something up.

You accidentally did git checkout . and lost all your work. 
Lose 800 points.

You haven't been to class in 3 weeks. 
Lose 700 points.

You haven't been to class in three weeks but it's video recorded so you're all good. 
Get 2352 points.

You got your exam back and it's not what you expected. 
Type y to submit a regrade and potentially lose more points (spend 200 points) or Type n to keep your low score even though you think you deserve more (spend 200 points)

optlist.description:
You were right. They misgraded your question and you got 25 points back bumping you to an A. 
Get 1400 points for checking and going through your exam.

You should've gotten a regrade. What's losing maybe a couple points in comparison to getting 25 back. 
Lose 100 for not making a good judgement.

action.description:
Gimme Coffee is giving away free coffee to VIP members like you. 
Get 1000 points and free drinks.

Gimme Coffee is closed. 
Lose 50 points.

The CS gods have blessed you. 
Get 1990 points.

You love playing games. You love making games. 
Type l to play League of Legends (spend 1000 points) or Type c to code your own game (spend 900 points).

optlist.description:
You didn't sleep. But you had fun! 
Yay for gaming, get 1000 karma.

You didn't sleep. But you made a super successful game for the app store. 
Yay for gaming, get 1000 karma.

action.description:
You got a C on your prelim. What's new? 
Lose 300 points.

You got an A on your prelim. This hasn't happened in a long time. 
Get 346 points.

You were supposed to finish your assignment at 12AM, but now it's 5AM and you feel like crying. 
Lose 1500 points.

It's your last internship before you graduate! 
Choose a place you'd want to go to full-time.
Get 300 points for being serious about your future.

Your little sister got into Cornell! Congrats! You've inspired her to be a CS major. 
Get 1923 for being a great role model.

You see the sunrise. YOU STAYED UP ALL NIGHT. NOW YOU CAN'T THINK, THEREFORE YOU CAN'T CODE. 
Lose 2352 points.
You realize you forgot iclicker during class. Type l to leave class now and do other work or Type s to stay in class (point values are unknown)

optlist.description:
You shouldn't go to class just for iclicker. You should go to learn. 
Lose 400 karma.

You stayed in class and you learned a lot. You also remembered how compelling of a speaker your Professor is. 
Get 2000 karma.

action.description:
You became Presdient of WICC/ACSU! CONGRATULATIONS! 
Get 1000 points and some karma.

You got your code to compile. Now you can take a break. 
Get 10 points for procrastinating.

You learned how to inspect element and you start messing with things :) 
Get 71 points

You had a breakdown today. The only thing holding you together is your skin. You can push through. 
Get 100 points for staying strong.

You have some time on your hands. 
Type s to start a side project (spend 1000 points) or Type b to binge watch a new netflix show (spend 2000 points).

optlist.description:
Side projects are awesome. You have complete control! 
Get 1900 karma for challenging yourself.
It's important to relax. Enjoy watching netflix for 23 hours and get 2300 karma too.

action.description:
You somehow fried your 1TB hard drive with everything on it. 
Lose 10000 points.

You to enjoy the sunset today. 
800 points for appreciating the beauty.

The prof asks a question. 
Type a to answer a question in class and dare to be wrong or type q to remain quiet (point values unknown)

optlist.description:
Good on you for taking a chance. But you got it wrong. 
Lose 10 karma.

You should've spoken up, you knew the answer! Be brave. 
Lose 10 karma.

action.description:
You got into a huge fight with your CS partner. She's not talking to you. 
Lose 5000 points because she is your lifeline.

You need coffee, but you're broke and out of BRBs. 
Lose 60 points for having to rely only on water.
Type m to marathon a tv show (spend 100 points) or type s to sleep for more than 15 hours (spend 150 points).

optlist.description:
The show was so good. 
Get 1000 karma.

Sleep is so good. 
Get 1200 karma.

action.description:
You saw lots of cute dogs today. Dogs make you happy. 
Get 10 points.

Life segfaulted. 
Lose 480 points.

Error 404: Brain not found. You need sleep. 
Lose 1000 points for not sleeping.

It's 4AM and you're carrying your group project cause everyone else is busy. 
Get 1000 points for being a good team member.

It's senior year and you're tired of taking hard classes. 
Choose a more chill course to free up some time.
(But lose 67 points for being a slacker.)
Today was another normal day. 0 points for mediocrity.

You got a lunch with some one you're interested in.
Get 100 points.

It's raining today. You decide to take a personal day. 
Get 20 points for some rest and relaxation.

You can choose to do research with one of the coolest professors at Cornell. 
Type y to do research and spend 100 points or Type n to not do research and enjoy senior spring (spend 10 points).

optlist.description:
You can get departmental honors! Yay for getting honor cords at grad. 
Get 5000 karma.

Nothing's new. Nothing has changed. 
Get 1000 karma.

action.description:
You meet a freshman CS major and decide to mentor them. Yay for mentorship. 
Get 1023 points for taking them under your wing.

You can't debug your synchronization project. Your code may or may not be right. 
Lose 3643 points for uncertainty.
Type y to take a 4000 level class pass/fail or type n to take a 12 credit semester (spending point values unknown)

optlist.description:
Learning is fun. Learning under no pressure is even more fun. 
Get 4000 karma.

It's senior spring. It's chill. It's time you take a break and enjoy Cornell. 
Get 1000 karma.

action.description:
Your SO is mad at you because you love coding more than you like them. 
Lose 190 points for a bad breakup.

Your classes are killing you. But it's senior year. Do you really care? 
Get 10 points for chilling out.

You study in MVR. Everyone there is beautiful and happy and HEALTHY. 
Lose 190 points for looking like shit.

You study in Statler library. Too bad you don't get wifi there. 
Lose 109 points.

You wonder if you will find a job. What if you don't? 
Overthinking and lack of confidence costs you 3432 points.
You can spend time finding a SO (type s) or spend time with friends (type f). (spending point values unknown)

optlist.description:
Sometimes, you just need a companion in life. 
Get 100 karma for taking a chance to find someone you love.

Friends are so important. They kept you sane during some of the most challenging moments here. 
Get 400 karma for friends forever.

action.description:
You haven't slept in a week. Your eyes burn. You can't code.
Lose 1932 points cause this week sucks.

You finished your last major CS assignment. Celebrate by gorge jumping.
Get 900 points and some karma.

You spend the day on the slope reading a good book. Life is good.
Get 288 points.

You met someone. Too bad it's senior year.
Lose 283 for trying to make it work.

They didn't steam your coffee enough at Gimme. 
Lose 463 points for cold coffee.

You've found a home here. You love CS. 
Get 1000 points for loving your major.

Wow! You got hired as the head TA. 
Get 530 points for loving baby CS majors <3

You're tired, but you still need to graduate. There's no time to waste. 
Go to Carpenter and crank out that pset. Lose 13 points.

You give your CS partner (and now lifetime friend) a hug. 
It's been a long journey, but you've made it. 
Get 528 points :)

You're looking forward to graduation. 
Feel the senioritis settle in for 395 points ;)

\ \ / / / \ \ \ / /
 \ V / / _ \ \ V / 
  | | / ___ \ | |  
  |_|/_/   \_\|_|  

Congratulations! You have graduated!! Now you get to choose your post-Cornell plans. You also get karma points.
